name: Buffalo Tempeh Ranch Sandwich
description: Tempeh blackened with spices then tossed in hot Buffalo sauce and served with Celery Ranch. Makes 2 or more sandwiches depending on the size of the Tempeh block
recipeIngredient: 8 oz pack of Black Bean Tempeh ( or other Tempeh)
a very generous dash of black pepper
1 tsp ranch seasoning (or equal quantity of parsley, dill, thyme, garlic and onion)

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the Tempeh to make 2 patties. Place the patties in a large skillet with a cup of water and blackening spice. Cook on medium heat for 14 to 17 minutes or until all the water is gone. Flip the patties mid way.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice the Tempeh to make 2 patties. Place the patties in a large skillet with a cup of water and blackening spice. Cook on medium heat for 14 to 17 minutes or until all the water is gone. Flip the patties mid way.

recipeInstructions.text: Add oil and toss to coat. Continue to cook at medium heat until some of the edges are crisp. Add the Sriracha, hot sauce and vinegar. Toss to coat and cook for a few seconds so the sauce heats up.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oil and toss to coat. Continue to cook at medium heat until some of the edges are crisp. Add the Sriracha, hot sauce and vinegar. Toss to coat and cook for a few seconds so the sauce heats up.

recipeInstructions.text: Place on sandwich, layer with greens/lettuce, tomato, celery ranch and serve. Make 2 sandwiches.
recipeInstructions.name: Place on sandwich, layer with greens/lettuce, tomato, celery ranch and serve. Make 2 sandwiches.

recipeInstructions.text: For Celery ranch, blend everything under celery ranch until smooth. Taste and adjust flavors and use.
recipeInstructions.name: For Celery ranch, blend everything under celery ranch until smooth. Taste and adjust flavors and use.
